text.section: In this subtitle, unless the context indicates otherwise, the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Apprentice" means an individual who:
is at least 16 years old;
has signed with an employer or employer's agent, an association of employers, an organization of employees, or a joint committee from both, an agreement including a statement of:
the trade, craft, or occupation that the individual is learning; and
the beginning and ending dates of the apprenticeship; and
is registered in a program of the Council or the Bureau of Apprenticeship and Training of the United States Department of Labor.

"Commissioner" means:
the Commissioner of Labor and Industry;
the Deputy Commissioner of Labor and Industry; or
an authorized representative of the Commissioner.
"Council" means the Apprenticeship and Training Council.

section.section: "Employee" means an apprentice or worker employed by a contractor or subcontractor under a public work contract.
"Employee" does not include an individual employed by a public body.
"Locality" means the county in which the work is to be performed.
If the public work is located within 2 or more counties, the locality includes all counties in which the public work is located.

text.section: "Prevailing wage rate" means the hourly rate of wages paid in the locality as determined by the Commissioner under § 17-208 of this subtitle.

section.section:
"Public body" does not include:
a unit of the State government or instrumentality of the State funded wholly from a source other than the State; or
any political subdivision, agency, person, or entity with respect to the construction of any public work for which less than 50% of the money used for construction is State money.

Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, "public work" means a structure or work, including a bridge, building, ditch, road, alley, waterwork, or sewage disposal plant, that:
is constructed for public use or benefit; or
is paid for wholly or partly by public money.

"Public work" does not include, unless let to contract, a structure or work whose construction is performed by a public service company under order of the Public Service Commission or other public authority regardless of:
public supervision or direction; or
payment wholly or partly from public money.

text.section: "Public work contract" means a contract for construction of a public work.
